column4: hi does anybody know what the values of x and y in this comman do?
[#ubuntu]  hi does anybody know what the values of x and y in this comman do?
[#ubuntu]  hi does anybody know what the values of x and y in this comman do?
splashimage (hdx,y)/boot/grub/images/ubuntu_foo.xpm.gz
sorry
(hd0,1) would be the first partition on the primary hdd
hmm ok where do you think should i place this as the splash image for grub
then presuming the /boot/ is on that partition it will find the file ubuntu_foo.xpm.gz
i don't think you should unless you are having grub wait for your decision.
cause if you set grub to auto boot then it's only on the screen for a second.
oh ok, so only good for dual boot or different kernels
you can get grub to wait and not auto boot and then it would be worth it.
how do you do that?
what? stop the auto boot? 'man grub'
you'll see a default boot option in /boot/grub/menu.lst
oh can i just set the wait time there?
aye. i'm just looking up to see if you set 0 that it waits... can't remember off the top of my head.
right now it's set to timeout 3
does anyone have a copy of sharethenet
does anyone remember sharethenet? the website is down and firebird619 needs a copy.
what is your timeout set to?
